Town Council

From left to right: Ann Martin, Brian Taylor,  Adam Schiestel, Cheryl Moore, Chris Drew, and Janvier Werner.

Meetings

  • First and third Monday of the month, with work sessions scheduled, as needed, on the third Thursday of the month.
  • 6 p.m.
  • Flower Mound Town Hall
    2121 Cross Timbers Rd.
    Flower Mound, TX 75028

Agendas, Packets, and Minutes

Agendas are posted online, and on the Town Hall notice board, at least 72 hours prior to the meeting. Should an agenda packet be prepared this will also be available online, along with any draft or approved minutes.
Most Recent Agenda | View Agenda Center

Voting Record

The following Town Council voting record for regular items only is effective November 16, 2020, and will be periodically updated by the Town Secretary's Office. There is a worksheet within the Excel file for each elected official. 

Voting Record 11.16.20 - 12.19.22

Voting Record 1.1.23 - 7.15.24 

Voting Record 7.16.24 - 12.31.24

Contact Us

Email the Mayor and Town Council simultaneously. Please note, all correspondence received is considered a public record and therefore may be subject to disclosure under the Texas Public Information Act.

Flower Mound Town Council Members are elected â€œat-largeâ€  for a 3-year term with term limits of no more than two full consecutive terms and the allowance of two additional terms if a councilmember becomes mayor.

About the Council

All powers of the Town, and the determination of all matters of policy, are vested in the Town Council. The powers of the council include, but are not limited to, adoption of the annual Town budget, appointment of a Town Manager, Town Secretary, Town Attorney, and Municipal Judge, and provide vision and direction for all Town policies and initiatives.
